intro: Chaetogastra rostrata, commonly known as the rostrated chaetogastra, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered umbels of white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its root system is fibrous and can be used in traditional herbal medicine. The species is notable for its unique floral structure and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
